name: choco-install
description: Runs Chocolatey Install with specified parameters
author: gep13

inputs.name: packageId
inputs.label: The id of the package(s) that are to be installed.

inputs.name: packageVersion
inputs.label: The version of the package that is to be installed.

inputs.name: source
inputs.label: The source to find the package(s) to install.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Special sources include: ruby, webpi, cygwin, windowsfeatures, and python. To specify more than one source, pass it with a semi-colon separating the values (e.g. "'source1;source2'"). Defaults to default feeds.

inputs.name: installargs
inputs.label: Install Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Install Arguments to pass to the native installer in the package.

inputs.name: params
inputs.label: Package Parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Parameters to pass to the package.

inputs.name: force
inputs.label: Force the behavior.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Do not use force during normal operation - it subverts some of the smart behavior for commands.

inputs.name: x86
inputs.label: Force X86.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Force x86 (32bit) installation on 64 bit systems.

inputs.name: override
inputs.label: Override Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Should install arguments be used exclusively without appending to current package passed arguments?

inputs.name: verbose
inputs.label: Show verbose messaging.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Very verbose messaging, avoid using under normal circumstances.

inputs.name: trace
inputs.label: Show trace messaging.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Very, very verbose trace messaging. Avoid except when needing super low-level .NET Framework debugging.

inputs.name: extraArguments
inputs.label: Extra Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional Chocolatey Arguments that are not catered for above.
